channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Per California Gov. Newsom, Trump order to send in Guard affects all states
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Gov. Gavin Newsom, D-Calif., about the protests in his state and the federal government's decision to send in the National Guard.

item.title: Low turnout causes Italy's referendum on citizenship and job protections to fail
item.description: An Italian referendum on granting faster citizenship to immigrants has failed due to low voter turnout. Italy's right-wing government was against it and tried to boycott the democratic process.

item.title: Amid conflict, a cultural blockade remains between India and Pakistan
item.description: Social media is one of the few places where India and Pakistan can come together. But during the most serious escalation between the two nuclear powers in decades, content was censored .

item.title: A self-driving car startup is taking on the streets of Lima
item.description: In Lima, a city known for some of the world's wildest traffic, a Peruvian startup is testing driverless cars.

item.title: The reaction as Trump's travel ban on citizens from a dozen countries takes effect
item.description: President Trump's travel ban on citizens from 12 countries went into effect today. Reaction to the ban has been more muted than to the bans of Trump's first term.

item.title: American science and technology may suffer if U.S. revokes visas for Chinese students
item.description: The Trump administration said it would begin to "aggressively" revoke visas from Chinese students with connections to China's ruling Communist Party or who were studying in fields deemed critical.

item.title: A seismic shift on clay: Carlos Alcaraz emerges the victor at French Open Final
item.description: The French Open started with a tearful farewell to the phenomenon that was Rafael Nadal â€” 14 time winner in Paris.

item.title: Spanish Flamenco thrives in New Mexico, with its own unique flavor
item.description: Albuquerque is home to the biggest flamenco gathering in the world outside Spain. One family has a lot to do with New Mexico embracing the art form.

item.title: Trump federalized the National Guard in L.A. Are more troops next?
item.description: Over the weekend, President Trump ordered 2,000 National Guard soldiers to Los Angeles, where people are protesting federal immigration raids.

item.title: Enlisting the national guard in deportation is a 'dangerous path' says former chief
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with retired Major General Randy Manner, former Acting Vice Chief of the National Guard Bureau, about President Trump federalizing the guard for his deportation campaign.
